Name: Agoda
Description: Agoda is a website owned by Booking Holdings.
Reason: Booking.com, whos parent company Booking Holdings owns Agoda, allows listings in occupied Palestinian territory, and after initially deciding to add a label to properties which are in occupied territory, reversed that move under pressure from Israel.
How to Boycott: Don't book on Agoda. Book directly with businesses. They usually offer discounts and similar terms for direct bookings. Don't list your services on Agoda. Don't work for Booking Holdings.

Name: Airbnb
Description: Airbnb is a platform for renting out properties.
Reason: Airbnb allows listings in occupied Palestinian territory, and after announcing it will remove 200 of such listings, it reversed its decision, showing it is knowingly complicit in Israels occupation.
How to Boycott: Don't rent property on Airbnb. Don't list property on Airbnb. Delete the Airbnb app. Don't work for Airbnb.

Name: Amazon
Description: Computer technology company
Reason: Amazon is investing $7.2bn in data centers in israel via AWS
How to Boycott: Don't spend money on amazon products including AWS. Do not work for Amazon. Do not buy Kindle books and other content from Amazon. Cancel your Amazon prime membership.

How to Boycott: Dont buy Dell products. Don't sell Dell products. If you are a company decision maker, find alternatives to Dell products.

How to Boycott: Don't work for Disney. Don't subscribe to Disney+. Cancel Disney+ if you have it. Don't watch Disney movies. Don't visit Disney theme parks. Don't buy Disney merchandise. Don't watch Disney TV shows.

Name: Marks and Spencer / M&S
Description: British multinational retailer that specialises in selling clothing, beauty products, home products and food products.
Reason: Marks & Spencer has been a pro zionist entity since its inception, with various members of its management openly declaring support for the zionist state. For over 100 years, they have been the biggest commercial conduit between Israel and the UK. More recently however, they have publicly distanced themselves from having 'political' ties and aims. And since the last statements in support of Israel were around the year 2000, it is difficult to tell how much their leadership supports Israel.
How to Boycott: Don't shop at M&S. Don't work for M&S.
